result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Margarita Castillo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Margarita Castillo not in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Schwarz is unable to appear due to attending a conference. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with ADR (DOB: 10/16/2007); NMT (DOB: 11/7/1988).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Margarita Castillo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard appeared by video for Margarita Castillo.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
